characters: NATALIE AND ALEX TURN TO SEE
OKAY, HERE'S AN OUTLINE OF WHAT WILL HAPPEN IN THE REST O
BACK WHERE AH'M FROM, WE RACE IN SWAMPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VIRGIN AIR 747 bursts through the clouds and levels off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move through the FIRST CLASS CABIN. It's the regular mix of first class people: OLD MONEY in Gucci enjoying freshly baked cookies, a MILLIONAIRE in jeans and a T- shirt, BUSINESS PEOPLE relaxing after a tough day, and... ...a very nervous MAN. Shifty-eyed. Alone in an aisle seat, the emergency row. We hold on him for a moment, but not for too long. Then we continue moving into --

dialogues.speaker: THE COACH SECTION
dialogues.text: Stopping at the lavatory, the "OCCUPIED" sign switches to "VACANT" and...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES EARL JONES
dialogues.text: (or actually, a James Earl Jones type, who for ease of description, we'll simply refer to as James Earl Jones) steps out of the restroom, in full African regalia: multi-colored dashiki, mufti (it's a kind of hat), the works. He heads up the aisle towards --

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST CLASS CABIN
dialogues.text: Where he is stopped by a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. This cabin is restricted to first cl... Mr. Jones now removes a FIRST CLASS TICKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you're looking for? She looks at it -- a little confused as to why he's just handing it to her now -- but then she nods. As he passes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Please. Is there anything I can get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotch, blended. Straight. He continues into the first class cabin and toward --

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST CLASS EMERGENCY ROOM
dialogues.text: Where he slides in past the nervous, shifty-eyed man (his name is PASQUAL) and sits by the window. After a moment, Pasqual quietly clears his throat and leans, slightly, towards Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively) They say birds can't fly this high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say only angels can. Now Pasqual nods. Nervously begins to remove something from his pocket when they are interrupted by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I pour your scotch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'll take the bottle. Thank you. She hands him the airplane-sized bottle -- he waves off the glass. She shrugs, leaving... Pasqual to resume what he was doing. Slowly, he removes a roll of Certs. He looks to Jones -- "Well? What about your end of the bargain?" From within his dashiki, Jones pulls out a black velvet pouch. He hands it to Pasqual, who opens it to find diamonds. A helluva lot of diamonds. Pasqual smiles. He hands the roll of Certs to Jones. It's not breath candy at all, but a tiny roll of explosives, with a tiny, high-tech triggering mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, c-5. The most dangerous explosive material ever invented. Hard to believe that this little contraption could blow up ten city blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with it, huh? Both men smile.   Pasqual's very relieved that the deal i done. Then suddenly, the lights blink out. Pasqual looks around, nervous. But it's just the in- flight movie beginning. Clouds, and a woman holding a torch.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Columbia Pictures presents... David Spade and Adam Sandler in "BOSOM BUDDIES: THE MOVIE." James Earl Jones shakes his head, rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another movie from an old TV show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very funny. But James Earl Jones is dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It isn't. Jones grabs Pascal in a headlock and turns toward the back of the plane, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Now Jones does the unthinkable. Holding Pasqual tight, he yanks open the emergency door release. With a RUSH, the cabin decompresses. Panic erupts as air, paper and everything not belted in screams out of the open door, including --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James Earl Jones, still holding Pasqual in a bear hug. They plummet, wind violently tearing at them. Pasqual's frantic SCREAMS doppler quite nicely.

dialogues.speaker: DROPPING WITH THEM
dialogues.text: They continue to fall, gaining speed. Pasqual is terrified, but Jones doesn't seem worried. In fact, casually, he glances at his watch, and then looks --

dialogues.speaker: FAR BELOW THEM
dialogues.text: At the tiny black speck gradually grows larger in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a jet helicopter. Its door opens, and now a SKYDIVER out, helmet down, arms back, streaking across the sky in aerodynamic perfection, heading directly towards

dialogues.speaker: JONES AND PASQUAL
dialogues.text: who are still plummeting toward the earth at terminal velocity. Jones begins to let go of Pasqual, who SCREAMS and tries to clutch onto him, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the rushing wind)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- WHOMMPPPH!! -- the skydiver spread-eagles, stopping the wild dive directly behind Pasqual, and immediately binds his arms and straps a parachute on him. All three are still free-falling. James Earl Jones nods at the Skydiver who, even under the helmet and goggles, is clearly a beautiful woman. Meet ALEXANDRA "ALEX" MUNDAY, one of Charlie's Angels. She's a sultry bombshell -- a classic femme fatale -- only she's playing for the good guys. She gives James Earl Jones a wink, then jerks Pasqual's rip cord and -- WHOOMPH. Pasqual's chute deploys. He flies upward, leaving -- Alex and James Earl Jones, both still falling.    Below t ocean screams up at them. Not much time left. James Earl Jones pulls his belt -- and his mufti flies up. It's actually a tiny drogue chute, deploying his entire dashiki. His outfit hides a parachute rig. Alex pulls her own rip cord and -- WHOOMPH -- her chute unfurls, and now... Alex and James Earl Jones gently float towards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette boat floats through the choppy water, a gorgeous young woman expertly throttling up the growling V-8. Say hello to NATALIE THOMPSON, Charlie's second angel. At a glance, she's the brainy-shy girl next door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But put her behind the wheel of any vehicle, and she's unstoppable. Natalie glances ahead, maneuvering the boat perfectly und Alex, who drops on deck. Alex gathers her chute, then whi her helmet to give her cascading mane a wild shake. Here comes James Earl Jones. Natalie guns the boat underneath...a perfect catch. Alex helps him with his dashiki-chute, and then all three look up... Here comes Pasqual. Natalie whips the boat around, catching him as he helplessly drops into the seats, still bound, still scared out of his wits. He gapes wild-eyed at the two Angels, then whirls on James Earl Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you mean crazy bitch. With that, James Earl Jones reaches up and pulls his face off. Latex rips free, and standing there (without his dashiki, James Earl Jones has a great figure) is... ... stunningly beautiful DYLAN SANDERS, angel number three. She's the wild one. Pasqual's jaw drops as Dylan shakes her hair free, then reaches in her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still with James Earl Jones' voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need this anymore. -- and extracts a voice-modifying chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now in her real voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I sure could use this. And she pulls from her pocket the airplane-size bottle of Johnnie Walker Black. She twists it open and downs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn I hate to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, MEN IN "FBI" WINDBREAKERS haul Pasqual away, two of them carefully handling the certs-explosive. A harmless fellow pushes his way past them and onto the dock. It's JOHN BOSLEY, Charlie's lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He reaches the boat, which Natalie ties off while Alex and Dylan neatly fold their parachutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Angels, the experimental explosives are back in the hands of the government, and the free world can breathe just a lit-tle bit easier tonight, thanks to you three. Alex, Natalie and Dylan stroll from the dock onto the san each starting to unzip/unbutton/unsnap their action gear hand it to Bosley as they continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks to you, too, Bos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't have redirected the flight path without your help. Bosley puffs, proud. He speaks over the ever-growing pile of chutes, body suits, goggles, the dashiki...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing a little teamwork can't do. At least, that's what Charlie's always telling us, right ladies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie will be joining us, won't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends his regrets. But he wanted you to know that dinner is on him, so feel free to celebrate. By now, the Angels have stripped off all of their equipment, revealing eye-popping evening gowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's on Charlie, we will. The Angels share a laugh as they arrive in their sassy duds at a private beach club, where a WAITER greets them with a tray of champagne flutes. They each take a glass, turn to each other and raise them. Another Angels Mystery... Case Closed. FREEZE FRAME.    And the TITLE SEQUENCE BEGINS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THREE FOURTH GRADE SCHOOL PHOTOS FILL THE FRAME, side by side by side. These are three very different girls. NATALIE, with a page-boy cut and wearing a Catholic schoolgirl's uniform, sports glasses and braces; a bit awkward and gangly, even shy. ALEX, formally dressed with perfect pig-tails, is sophisticated and self-possessed; a class act, even at te DYLAN, wild blond hair and faded T-shirt, has a jaded, street-wise smirk; even at this young age, her isolation and disillusionment are masked by seeming confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... there were three very different little girls. The triptych remains on screen.    Now it shifts into:

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO TAPE
dialogues.text: Now TEENAGERS, on HOME VIDEO. NATALIE, working the A-V equipment at school, hides her face in embarrassment, uncomfortable with the camera. FREEZE. ALEX, in riding gear, accepting her steeple-chase trophy. She knows where to look for the camera. FREEZE. DYLAN, smoking with her tough-girl friends in the girls' room of her reform school, is caught on camera. She flips it off. FREEZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who grew up into three very different women.

dialogues.speaker: TRIPTYCH CONTINUES
dialogues.text: They're all WOMEN now, in their early twenties. NATALIE, a research fellow at MIT (and beautiful, but not flaunting it) demonstrates a chess-playing computer program to a room of impressed advisors. ALEX, valedictorian at Oxford, passionately delivers her address to a crowd of rapt students, faculty and parents. DYLAN, in leather and a helmet, steps off a Harley. She sees a punk with a mohawk slapping around his girlfriend. She decks him, then enters the back door of a seedy punk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With three things in common...

dialogues.speaker: TRIPTYCH ENDS
dialogues.text: With photographs again. The women, as they are now: Natalie, Alex, Dylan. All gorgeous, all self-assured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're brilliant. They're beautiful. And they work for me. Now, FIREBALL EXPLOSIONS completely fill the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Charlie. ANGEL SILHOUETTES appear, in flames.    New MUSIC kicks i "CHARLIE'S ANGELS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And a new title sequence takes over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credits continue as we watch the Angels in action (from, presumably, previous adventures...) -- A microscope-peering Natalie cuts a ruby, drops it in a laser housing, shoots a red beam. --   Dylan, wielding kendo sticks, spars with two Yakzuza -- Alex side-kicks two baddies, spins, drops a third. ZOOM BACK: she is at the Parthenon. -- A motocross race. Natalie digs in for the finish, attacking the last jump with gusto. -- Dylan, in traditional Islamic robes, finds a secret switch. She pushes back a bookcase to reveal secret stair -- At a ballroom dance competition, Alex wows the crowd while keeping her eye on a nefarious couple. -- Bosley, as "Luka, the Bad Ass Pimp," bitch-slaps a couple of "ho's" -- actually Dylan and Alex -- then winks at them as unsuspecting drug dealers back off, scared. --   Natalie bites into a messy hot-dog, has to just laug -- The three angels elbow their way through a roller- derby match. -- In orange prison jumpsuits, Alex and Dylan work in female chain-gang. -- Window-washer Natalie peers into a skyscraper office, surreptitiously photographing the meeting inside.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- On an Italian street, the three Angels buy a paper, grin at the headline, "Mystery Women Save European Union." As they high-five, Dylan's cone of gelato drops to the sidewalk. The Angels look at it, look at each other...and just have to laugh. TITLE SEQUENCE ENDS. OVER BLACK we hear a DIGITAL RING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Dylan as she wakes up in a tangle of ugly sheets, disoriented and a bit hungover. She hears the RINGING -- where is it coming from? Why is it drilling into her head? Checking the floor, she finds her jeans. Digs in the pocket to find her cell phone. Answering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (recognizing voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.   Okay. I'll be right in. She clicks the phone off, then starts looking around. Where the fuck is she? From the next room, we hear a male VOICE singing "My Sharona." She checks under the sheets. Oh God. She's naked. She pulls her shirt from the floor, puts it on. Closing her eyes, she prays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not him.   Not him, not him, not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning starfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God no. At the door, skinny shirtless CHAD holds a skillet of egg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinded by the daylight, Dylan emerges from below, relieved to see the boat is docked. Chad follows her outside, pleading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Dylan. You + Me. It's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mistake. A horrible, horrible mistake. She jumps onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come we keep getting back together? It's fate. Dylan just keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because I live on a boat?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: This is Jason Gibbons, handsome, action-movie stud. concentrating fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't defuse this bomb, Logan, L.A.'s going to be a new underwater attraction. A bead of sweat drops down Jason's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off my back, Sanchez.   I know what I'm doing. REVEAL ALEX, her face right next to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which wire?   The red one or the blue one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marix has a thing for red. Red cars, red boats, red-headed hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the red one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm gonna say blue. He makes a "snip" motion.     They both breathe a sigh of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved the world again, Logan. She leans forward, closer and closer, right in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job. Alex kisses him. It's a damn good kiss.          Jason's it, but pulls away for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Sanchez would kiss me. He's a forty-year-old man. Pull back to reveal... ALEX and JASON are in a fully macked out Airstream, sitting on a bed, leaning over an open screenplay. We can tell from our surroundings that Jason is a big deal Hollywood action star, and this trailer is his home away from home. She licks the bridge of his nose, then kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have it rewritten. As she smiLes, a cell phone RINGS. Both Alex and Jason reach for their phones. It's hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason stands in the doorway in his robe as Alex tosses her stuff in the back of a very excellent car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure.   Whenever I can.      I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great, that's helpful. (watching her prepare to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, what kind of executive assistant is on 24 hour call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me, your boss is an asshole. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I get to meet this Charlie guy, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's not very social.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I think you should quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you. Alex looks back -- that was more personally revealing than she expected. A P.A. comes up next to Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbons?   We're ready for you on the set. Jason nods, then back to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go save the world. Alex smiles at the irony of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hero. She blows him a kiss and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie KNOCKS on the door to 113.      A beat later, the door swings open to reveal BOB. Natalie SCREAMS in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!   Natalie, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead. She pushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie makes a beeline for his keys on the table. Starts taking one key off the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the police might be here. Or your neighbors. Or your parents, here to identify your remains. He has no idea what she's talking about.         She goes

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM,
dialogues.text: where she retrieves a toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your car was here, so I knew you weren't carjacked and brutally beaten, left to die on the highway. Her cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... She holds up a finger, just a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Absolutely. I'll be right in. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can understand why I thought so. You missed our date last night. You didn't call or anything. I was just sitting there by myself. ANGLE ON Bob.    What can he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tolerate a lot, but punctuality and attendance, those rank very high in my list of dating priorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain. Behind Natalie, a door opens.          A topless BLONDE l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Natalie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind the Blonde, ISAAC HAYES looks out.      He's also

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Beyond weirded out, Natalie just leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing cars reveal the one and only CHARLES TOWNSEND DETECTIVE AGENCY. That's what the sign says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In foreground, a blender WHIRRS. Still hungover, Dylan cringes from the sound. Natalie pours out three fruit smoothies for the angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once, I want to date a normal man, without a wife, or a drug addiction, or bondage issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here here. She and Natalie toast.       Alex is only half-in. Off th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    I've got a great relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend thinks you're a secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way, he doesn't ask about my work. Bosley walks in with a folder.       He eyes their drinks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bosley. I only made enough for three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's...That's okay. It's not okay, but that's our Bosley. He takes his seat behind his desk. Now we see the biggest addition to the office, the Angels Wall of Fame.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pictures of every angel, from the original cast members t fictitious ones we've never seen before. The rest of the is exactly as we remember it, right down to the SPEAKERPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing-songy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Charlie. The angels take a seat on couches and chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to call you back from vacation, but we've got a case that just can't wait. As he's talking, the far blinds close themselves. A white screen lowers from the ceiling, ready to catch the projected VIDEO: A handsome MAN IN HIS 20'S in a CNN profile. The sound is muted, be we see him attending a gala; in an office surro by computers; rock climbing; smiling in a sit-down interv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Eric Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is. Oops, did Bosley say that out loud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's 28-years old, and in three days he'll be a billionaire, when his company, Knox Technologies, goes public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the catch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, Knox was kidnapped from his own office. ON VIDEO: Surveillance camera footage of a parking garage. Two MEN IN HOODS shove Knox into black car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any ransom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's heard a thing from the kidnappers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want money. They just want to sink our company. A striking WOMAN IN A SUIT stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels, meet Vivian Wu, vice president of finance for Knox Technologies. She's hired us to find Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The initial public offering is in three days. If we don't get Mr. Knox back, or if word gets out that he's missing, the company stands to lose a billion dollars. She seems to direct this next sentence right to Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, I want you and Bosley to stake out Roger Corwin. Bosley is excited to hear his name mentioned. ON VIDEO: Roger Corwin. He's an unpleasant-looking man, who's even nastier when he tries to smile. We see logos for his company, Red Star Systems

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the past year, he's been trying to buy Knox's company and their new browser software. Knox refused to sell. His company, Red Start Systems, has the most to gain from Knox's disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnap the founder and you sink the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, Alex. Let's keep our eyes on Mr. Corwin, Angels. If Knox is still alive, Corwin might lead us to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance you can join us, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see his chalky fingers grabbing into a hand hold. We're halfway up the face of Yosemite's El Capitan -- the ground is hundreds of feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, angels, but I've got my hands full this morning. Two beautiful and buxomly CLIMBING BUDDIES smile at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built into the Palm Springs Hills, this very exclusive spa has a fantastic view of the desert. Dressed in a crisp spa uniform, Alex has a sidebar with a white-robed Bosley. She shows him a tiny electronic device shaped like a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a transmitter. I'll be able to hear everything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I hide it? (leaning close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be nude. Alex takes a plastic cup, drops the transmitter into it. Covers it over with ice chips from a nearby bucket. Bosley nods, clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to get Corwin to talk about the industry, Knox, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. She points him in the direction of the men's spa.    But frozen with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   You'll do great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of steam clears, revealing Bosley. He waddles for in his shower clogs, which SQUISH with every step. He's w two towels: one around his waist, and a second around his chest. As more steam dissipates, we see there    are SEVEN MEN s the risers. Six are gorgeous, ranging     from Calvin Kle to Marlboro Men. Bosley looks around,     taking a keen i Maybe he's checking them out, maybe he    isn't. We just know. The seventh man is ROGER CORWIN, who we recognize from the videotape. He's leaning forward, a gold chain dangling. It's beside him that Bosley takes a seat. He sets the ice cup -- and the transmitter -- in a strategic location. Noticing that none of the other men have towels around their bosoms, Bosley nervously undoes his, revealing skin the color of cooked salmon. He fluffs up his sparse chest then decides to smush it back down. He tries to make eye contact with Corwin, working way too hard. Annoyed, Corwin finally looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot in here, isn't it? Corwin shakes his head, idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just came here to unwind a little. Business these days is go go go. My company just held an initial pubic offering. Yes, he said "pubic." He's about to correct himself when a very hot guy across from him moves his towel to wipe of

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: some sweat. We don't see the promised land, but Bosley does. It flusters him. He sees another guy eating ice chips. Good idea.      Bos does the same. He eats another. And another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re-composed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what business are you in? Corwin seems wary, but Bosley is clearly harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers.   Software.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers, hunh? What do you know about this new browser from Knox Technologies? Corwin bristles at the mention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word on the street is, once they raise capital, they'll rule the industry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see that happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Why not? The door opens, a rush of steam. ADONIS HIMSELF enters. Picking a seat behind Bosley, he pulls off his towel as he passes. We just see a bit of ass, but Bosley is face- to-face with the babymaker. One ice chip is not going to do it.    He chugs the rest his cup, including

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSMITTER
dialogues.text: which BLEEPS.    Corwin and others look over.    What the was that? The device still in his mouth, Bosley has no choice but t smile and swallow. His eyes go wide as he chokes it down. Corwin gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice talking with you. Another BLEEP. He shuts his mouth tight. Smiles. Rubs his chest a bit, trying to get the transmitter down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corwin walks into a lushly-appointed private massage room. A masseuse dressed in a skimpy robe, her back to us, oils up her hands sensuously near the window. MASSEUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German accent) Please to take off clothes, Mr. Corvin. Corwin gets under the sheet, on his stomach. The masseuse turns around, and now we see that it's Alex. Alex starts to work on his back. She is clearly an expert at this. This is a legit place, but there's something undeniably sensual about the whole experience. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're carrying a lot of tension along ze fourth und fifth vertebrae. Let me see if I can vork it out. Under the table, we look up to see Corwin's face in the cradle. He's in a tortured rapture. Alex works along Corwin's back and neck.   She pulls his arms out to the side. ALEX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The human body is an amazing instrument. Just by activating ze right energy points, you can improve ze circulation, alleviate pain, or... Corwin goes limp. ALEX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing the accent) ... knock a man unconscious. Confident Corwin is out cold, she slides the key strap off his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making sure she's alone, Alex uses the key to open a locker. She carefully sorts through Corwin's things, finding his Palm Pilot organizer. She clicks it into a special device, which BLIPS as it downloads all his information. Putting the Palm Pilot away, she shuts the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Corwin as he suddenly wakes up, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just when we think Alex's plan has failed, we TILT UP to see Alex is right there. She's massaging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have dozed off. A beat. Yeah, he must have.     A patented ANGELS FLIP leads us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Angels are all in the car together, cruising down Sunset Boulevard. Dylan drives, Alex in the passenger sea Natalie in the back seat with her computer on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you not drive my car so fast, Dyl? I'm trying to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex, under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive too fast. Look who's talking. She pulls into an In N' Out Burger, right up to the drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three double doubles, animal style. Fries. Three chocolate shakes. While they wait for their order, Natalie punches something up on her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Corwin's itinerary. ONSCREEN -- we see a list of all Corwin's plans for the next week. Two events in particular stand out:

dialogues.speaker: THURSDAY
dialogues.text: Dylan glances over the schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we'll hit the reception tonight. I only wish we had a clue to go on. The food comes, Dylan takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that thought.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie goes back to the computer again, slipping a CD into the drive. Dylan hands out the food, spilling a lot of it. A big glop of chocolate shake lands on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hello?   Expensive equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Natalie licks the shake off her fingers, tapes away at the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. New program I just got from a friend in the Bureau. We take that footage from the kidnapping... On screen, the footage downloads from the CD, into the program. Natalie fast forwards through it until she comes to a shot of one of the kidnappers where his mask is partly pulled away from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... isolate the part of the suspect's face that's revealed, then retriangulate his bone structure... The program zooms in on the revealed part of his face, then runs a series of calculations. A new drawing starts to appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and voila!     We've got a composite. Natalie's portable printer spits out a simulated composite of one skinny, bad-looking dude. Dylan grabs it, looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. Now we've got someone to look for. She hands it to Alex to inspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. He'll be easy to spot with that open head wound. She turns the composite around, revealing that Dylan has smudged his head with ketchup. They all just have to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sophisticated reception is in full swing, an ocean of smart suits and power ties. Dressed as a catering waitress, Natalie carries a tray of hors d'oeuvres. MOVING WITH her, we pass ROGER CORWIN, wh talks with another suit, and further on, a conservatively dressed DYLAN who chats up a group of WALL STREET TYPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The average investor sees technology stocks as discrete entities, "This one is up 50 points, this one is down 10." It's only through derivative analysis that one sees the real power of that sector. A few nods.    She makes a good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which analysis method do you prefer? On Dylan.    Shit.     She tries to stall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there are so many options. I mean, who can say what the one best choice is?

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Still walking, Natalie talks to no one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keppler-Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my money, Keppler-Wilson is a strong choice. More nods, ad-libbed agreement.        The Broker Guy is Excusing herself, Dylan turns and subtly touches her ear, where she's wearing a hidden radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Natalie loads champagne flutes onto her tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime what? She looks up to see a very cute bartender, PETE (26). She didn't realize he was so close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime, day or night, I am... excited ... to be handing out champagne. Oh God.   What did she just say?       But he smiles anyw She heads back out into the crowd.       You can almost s the big L on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Dylan has been watching this.        We INTERCUT between and Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-five percent of relationships begin in the workplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bartender. I need dependable. I need reliable. I need a Volvo man. Natalie walks past Dylan, not acknowledging her.        D snaps her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss!   Miss!   I'd love some champagne. Natalie comes back, a little annoyed. Dylan takes a glass for herself, then foists the other glasses on everyone around her, whether they wanted it or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Natalie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get some more? She nudges Natalie in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: We TILT UP from a Japanese comic book to Pete.       He suddenly realizes Natalie is waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He starts filling more flutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you reading? He holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the new Michio Kazura. That's not even out in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Michio Kazura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?    Warriors of the Broken Earth?   Classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I just moved back from Tokyo. It was the biggest thing since Haikiri Nomura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomuru nasgawa ishi Tokyo sen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nagada quing-gong ni.     Ni zeru. Imagine that.    Natalie takes her tray and reluctantly heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him out.   Ask him out.

dialogues.speaker: ON NATALIE
dialogues.text: She turns and heads back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete.    Good to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, there's an animation festival at the Egyptian this week. I was wondering if you might want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night? Eight o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: ON DYLAN
dialogues.text: She smiles, hearing the deal close. Pushing through a cluster of investors, she bumps into a THIN MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me. He doesn't respond, but something about this man raises her suspicions. Where has she seen him before? As he moves out of earshot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie.   Nine o'clock. Thin man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Spotting the Thin Man, she heads his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegetarian spring roll? He waves her away, no. Oops, she drops a napkin in front of him. She kneels down to get it. As we move in VERY CLOSE ON her tray, we see that there's a tiny Digital display. A metal detector is built into the rim. It BLIPS as she moves past his ankle. And again as she rises up past his chest. The man just keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to earpiece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guns. One ankle, one shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take point. I'll circle behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thin Man is headed down the hall.    Looking back, we see Dylan enter from the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? He doesn't turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, do you know which way the ladies' room is? The man takes a sudden right into a service hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they always run? She slips off her heels to give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thin Man comes around the corner.       We stay TIGHT him, until he suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: has come around from the other side. His bad guy instinct tell him these women are working together. He's boxed in. And then, a DING! Elevator doors open beside him. He looks in to see the cl less BELLBOY, who had a funky groove going on his headpho In a single motion, the Thin Man yanks the guy out into t hallway and takes his place. Hits the button. From opposite directions, Natalie and Dylan run to the elevator, but the doors have already shut. Checking the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going down. They take the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Dylan emerge from the staircase to find the elevator empty. To the left, exit doors swing tellingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nat and Dylan smash through the exit doors and out into the sun-drenched streets of beautiful, downtown Los Angeles. Natalie immediately spots the Thin Man, booking down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And they take off after him. What ensues is the fastest, wildest, two chicks and one guy foot chase you've ever seen. Here are some highlights -- Thin Man pulls himself, clumsily, over a chain link fence. Dylan and Natalie pull an old Jackie Chan trick and run up the side wall and hop over easily. -- Thin Man, still on foot, waits for traffic to slow, then darts across the Harbor Freeway. By the time Dylan and Natalie get there, traffic is roaring again. Undeterred, they make their way through, tucking and rolling under the wheels of a moving semi. -- Dylan is racing down an alley, when a car comes barrel at her. She leaps up onto the hood of the car as it drive underneath her, a la one of those That's Incredible! stun -- They chase the Thin Man into an industrial laundromat. The scene goes something like this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunderously LOUD, with industrial washers and dryers ope at full tilt. Natalie and Dylan are just entering when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ring out.    They dive for cover behind a massive washer assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are times I wish we carried guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the challenge in that? ANGLE ON the Thin Man, planning his next move. With no good shot at the angels, he aims high, both guns BLAZING. He shots out the pipes over their heads, sending down a cascade of hot water. Dylan and Natalie scramble back to avoid getting scalded. Other pipes SHATTER from the change in pressure, leading to an interior thunderstorm. Steam fills the room as an inch of water grows on the floor. Natalie and Dylan push rolling laundry carts in the Thin Man's direction. He shoots at them, but quickly realizes they're just trying to waste his bullets. Holstering one of his guns, he dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the far wall, Natalie switches on the overhead hooks, which circle on a wire like a ski lift. The Thin Man looks up, distracted, not noticing --

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: As she creeps up behind the cover of the rolling laundry carts. She's succeeded in circling behind the Thin Man as he talks on the phone. She clears her throat.      The Thin Man turns.   She kic him in the jaw. Knocked back, he drops the phone, which CRACKS and slips under a washing machine. He crab-walks back, then suddenly springs back to his fee We weren't expecting that kind of ninja move out of this

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: right behind him. With a coiled towel, she grabs his gun arm and expertly flips him. But he reacts smoothly, rolli over to charge at Natalie, picking her up like a sack of potatoes. As he does, he grabs her right in the tit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Hands off, assh.... Before she can finish her sentence, the Thin Man throws Natalie at Dylan, knocking them both down. He jumps up, and with a single motion grabs an overhead pipe and kicks another, releasing a wall of steam -- we can't see a thin By the time the fog clears, the Thin Man is long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, to summarize? Damn. Lying down in the water, Dylan reaches under the washer to fish out the Thin Man's busted cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie sits at a glowing computer monitor, the Thin Man's cell phone connected by a data cable to the Townsend Agency computers. Rapidly touching the screen, she calls up a list of the last thirty-five phone calls he received. They're all from the same location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.   That was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't. She points to some code next to the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen this before, he's scrambling his calls through a secondary location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to tap this phone line at the source, THEN we'll know where his calls were coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out the numbers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 503?   That's not local, where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bos, can we check a directory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother. I know where it is. I used to spend every winter there. As she says it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign says it:     Welcome to Aspen. VARIOUS ESTABLISHING SHOTS of the gorgeous mountain town, still somehow quaint despite its astonishing wealth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rowdy establishment just outside of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of place that rich weekend skiers don't come. Lots of over-aggressive, cowboy-biker types, drinking mor than they should. There are only a few women in the place and they are either waitresses or biker chicks. Suddenly, everyone stops what they're doing and turns to the door. CHARLIE'S ANGELS have entered the room. Dressed in their stylish ensembles, they couldn't possibly look more out o place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look!   Mechanical bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on the prize, Nat.   We gotta tap the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That looks like our target. She points to a door at the back of the bar that leads into a glassed-in office. Two, beefy bouncer types are gu the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need a distraction. Dylan and Natalie smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that can be arranged. The Three Angels split up, Bosley tagging along with Dyla

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: sidles up to the bar. A group of three rednecks are downing shots, one after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three shots of tequila, please. (Bosley whispers in her ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one Tom Collins. The rednecks stare at Dylan, drooling.       Dylan turns one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby, why don't you ditch that stiff and come sit on ma lap? Bosley tries to make himself small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, that is an enticing offer. But I got a better idea. How about a shot contest? My treat? The three rednecks hoot and holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll take that as a yes. Bartender? Bring ten shots of tequila over to my table. And keep em coming.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A group of wanna bes are waiting their turn at the mechanical bull. Natalie wanders over behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I try? The crowd parts for her, and Natalie hops up on the bull. She cranks it up, and lets

dialogues.speaker: BY THE BAR --
dialogues.text: Dylan downs a shot, slams it on the table.      Countless other glasses surround her. REVEAL that two of the rednecks are down for the count, o falling out of his chair, the other passed out on the tab The third redneck is slurring badly, trying to keep up with Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've got an idea. Now let's have a chair throwing contest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chair throwing? Never heard of it? You just pick up your chair and throw it as far as you can. The redneck nods, lifts up his chair and heaves it across the bar.

dialogues.speaker: THIS SCENE
dialogues.text: Dylan and Natalie create a distraction, while Alex sneaks into the back office with Bosley to get the phone number of the chalet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VW van climbs the winding road.       As we get closer, side reads, "Chalet Grams." A DING-DONG DING-DING-DONG doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO THUGS with shoulder holsters look up, hearing the bel One was tending to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We expecting somebody?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Thug Two shakes his head. Checking his gun, Thug One grabs for his windbreaker. Puts it on over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug One opens the door to find Dylan and Natalie dressed in Swiss Miss outfits, complete with blonde braids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Tag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting Dylan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Morgen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting Natalie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Nacht!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to each other)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Freund! The girls lean in and hug each other, butts sticking out. To the left, Bosley starts playing oommpa OOMMPA oommpa OOMMPA on a wrap-around tuba. He's wearing lederhosen, with a feather in his hat. Natalie begins to YODEL. Dylan hands a fancy envelope to the bewildered thug. Thug Two is approaching from behind, curious what the hell is going on. Dylan begins to TALK-SING a song in German about a too- curious goat and his worried mistress. Even with the pant we have no idea what's happening. It seems wholesome, but occasionally one of the girls touches the other in a weirdly coquettish, oddly sexual way. Thug Two looks at the address on the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got the wrong address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. As the angels continue their routine, the CAMERA RISES, three quick cuts to take us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where a black cat-suited Alex stands at the chimney... A ribbon of smoke curls from the stack. Pulling the pin from a canister, she drops it down the chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheerful fire burns in the over-sized fireplace. The canister drops into the flames from above, suddenly venting a HISSING cloud of halon gas. The fire dies immediately, the logs covered with a violent frost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex doesn't even need a rope. Her feet pressed to the sooty walls, she expertly slides to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex backs out of the fireplace to find a WAITING BAD GUY swinging

dialogues.speaker: A FIREPLACE POKER
dialogues.text: at her head. She ducks just in time.     The poker CHINGS against the stone, making a spark. Rolling, jumping and diving, Alex scurries as Pokerman slashes and stabs. She ducks behind a chair, which Pokerman catches with the hook, winging it across the room. Backed against the wall, Alex yanks on the heavy curtains, pulling them down, along with the wooden curtain rod. A spin, a flourish of velvet and the curtain rings drop off to leave her with a trusty quarterstaff. She goes on the offensive.    Thrust, parry, spin. But he's a worthy adversary. One good karate kick breaks her staff in two. She uses both pieces to club him in the knees, then rolls back to the fireplace. She grabs the remaining tool: the fireplace tongs. Pokerman swings. Alex catches his weapon in the tong scissors, yanking it free with such force the point stick in the wall. A quick kick knocks Pokerman to the floor, where Alex rolls on top of him. She catches his head in the tongs, squeezing his temples. His eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Knox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young billionaire ERIC KNOX paces. He's grungy, with two days of stubble, but still a darn attractive guy. Hearing a KICK at the door, he turns. A second KICK blows the door open.     It's Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calvary.     Giddy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley is about to hyper-ventilate on the tuba, sweaty and a little blue. Dylan and Natalie's new song has them sharing the saddle of an imaginary horse. When Dylan reaches back to slap the "horse," she hits Natalie in the rump. Both women tee-hee. The thugs think it's pretty hot. Dylan whispers a secret to Natalie.     Natalie WHISPERS back. Turning to the thugs, they each lean in to WHISPER into a different thug's ear. As the men smile, the angels suddenly BONK the two men's heads together. Both men fall, knocked out. Stepping over the bodies, Dylan heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for the way out, Alex leads Knox to a closed door. She opens it to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TWO MORE THUGS sitting in front the big-screen TV, watching a college basketball game (Duke vs. Maryland, in case you care.) The guards look back, spotting Alex with Knox. That wouldn't be so bad, if it weren't for the

dialogues.speaker: FIFTEEN OTHER THUGS
dialogues.text: watching the game with them. ANGLE ON Alex.   It's an oh-shit moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.    Wrong room. (to Knox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back!    Run! The thugs are out of their seats a moment later, each of them pulling out a firearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding down three keys on the tuba, Bosley talks into the mouthpiece. It has a secret radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, what's your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running, Alex pushes Knox ahead of her, checking their backs. She talks into a wrist-mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news:   I found Knox. Another THUG steps out in front of her.      She kicks hi down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news:    I found company. Reaching the bottom of the steps, Knox is surprised to be grabbed by Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. At this point, he'll do whatever they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan rushes Knox across the driveway to the waiting van -- Natalie is pulling it around. Overhead, bright security lights switch on. Back at the front door, Alex pulls it shut. She attaches a carabiner clip to the handle, running a thin steel cord from it around the porch column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first of the thugs reaches the door, tries to pull it open but can't. The next few guards try to help him, while the rest start smashing through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running with the tuba, Bosley stops for a moment to catch his breath, hands on his knees. Okay, ready to run again. He's the last to be pulled into the van.    A spray of gravel and they're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is piled on top of each other. Dylan and Knox have a few awkward moments as they get untangled. Bosley keeps making inappropriate TUBA NOISES. At the wheel, Natalie is fierce and focused, in total control. Looking out the back windows, Alex sees the kidnappers piling into jeeps to give chase. From the side of the house, more thugs appear on motorbikes. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming after us. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Knox, confident) We were expecting that. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, new problem. Everyone's attention WHIPS FORWARD to see the headlights

dialogues.speaker: GIANT LOGGING TRUCK
dialogues.text: coming up the high mountain road. It straddles the center line, blocking both directions. There's no way around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thoughts, suggestions, points to consider? BOSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose giving up would be a... No, it wouldn't.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She points to a faded "CLOSED" sign that hangs from a chain. In the darkness, who knows what it's blocking. But as we hear the THUNDEROUS HORN from the oncoming truck, we know there's no choice. Natalie cuts a hard right, SMASHING through the sign. The van THUMPS AND BUMPS its way across the low grass, its headlights only showing ten feet ahead. At any moment, the ground could stop in a cliff. Like now. The van leaps into empty space.      Tires spin, helpless The van falls. Everyone SCREAMS.    Bosley is the loudest. And then, touchdown. The van hits the ground, hard but not catastrophically. Natalie hits the brakes, cuts the wheel hard to avoid hitting

dialogues.speaker: A CONCRETE WALL
dialogues.text: in front of them.    Everyone takes a beat to acknowledge they're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? Suddenly, a BRIGHT LIGHT goes on overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, a series of arc lights switches on, forming a snake all the way to the bottom of the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out the back windows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bobsled run. They're facing backwards. Up ahead, the kidnappers are charging down the access roa The first of two jeeps makes the jump into the bobsled ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it goes down the mountain, that's all I need. Throwing it into reverse, Natalie peels out. The jeeps follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VW Van leads the way down the mountain, tail-first. As it builds speed, it starts to climb the wall, each tur getting steeper and steeper. The two jeeps are following. Facing the right direction, they have a much easier time of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is shaking so violently, it looks like a NASA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out the back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard left! HARD LEFT! Natalie makes the turn. The van rises up, nearly tilting over. But they make it through the turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dylan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this part of the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Except for the bobsled run, and the backwards part, it's going exactly according to plan. A beat.   He smiles at her.   He has a nice smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the jeeps makes a move, closing the distance to the van. A RIFLEMAN leans out the passenger window, lining up a shot. He FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot blasts cleanly through the top of the windshield through the horn of Bosley's tuba, then out the back wind missed hitting somebody by millimeters. Natalie is still focused, making each turn as Alex calls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front jeep gets even more aggressive, building speed. It hits the next turn too fast, rising up too high along the wall. It tips further, and further, finally rolling over onto its back. It SCRAPES across the concrete, a shower of sparks as it slows down. With nowhere to go, the second jeep brakes hard, but can' It SMASHES into the first jeep, a tangle of steel.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The combined mass continues sliding down the run, like a jagged pinball in the chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan looks out through the windshield as the jeep combo farther and farther away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're in the clear. Just then, two MOTORBIKES race up along the chute walls, the crippled jeeps. Two more MOTORBIKES jump in from abov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe not. Suddenly, Natalie GASPS, remembering something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Pete stands in front of the sign for the anime festival, two tickets in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a date with Pete.   Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: HARD RIGHT
dialogues.text: Natalie makes the hard right. The motorcycles are gaining them, but Natalie and Dylan have to talk through this fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him, he'll totally understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gee, sorry Pete. I had to rescue a billionaire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard left! She makes the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sound like a flake.   I can't stand flakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will so give you the second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I saw the way he looked at you. One motorcycle charges, coming up just feet from the windshield. Natalie taps on the brakes. The freaked out guy can't slow down in time. He SMACKS into the windshiel then goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the bottom! Indeed, we are. The concrete walls end, leaving open grou Slamming on the brakes, Natalie turns the van around. Everyone goes flying. Bosley is still on the phone with Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back facing the right direction, the van charges onward. The motorcycles race up to the passenger side, grabbing for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan SLAMS open the door, knocking one RIDER off. The sliding door opens, another RIDER outside trying to g in. Thinking fast, Knox grabs Bosley's tuba and shoves it at the motorcyclist, who tumbles, taking out the fourth rider in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: thunders over.    We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is at the controls, Bosley beside her.      Alex forward from the second row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that went very well. Charlie should send me on more missions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't have done it without you, Bos. Natalie pats him on the arm. She and Alex exchange a quic glance. They have to just laugh. In the back row, Knox is looking out over the gorgeous li of Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocktail? She offers him an airplane-sized bottle of Johnnie Walker black. He takes it and toasts. They both down their drink in a single shot. A smile, and then... MUSIC rises. THE ANGELS TRIPTYCH descends. The act is over.    After a beat, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re-establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is on the speakerphone.      The angels are in th usual lounging positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Angels. Not only did you save Knox, you saved his company as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that earns us a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Fiji?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Natalie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any special guy you were thinking of inviting? Natalie grins a guilty smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Angels.     Our work is only half-done. Knox enters. Clean-shaven and neatly pressed, he's still darn good-looking man. Vivian Wu follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet your new client, Eric Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, thank you. You rescued me, for which I am eternally grateful. He's talking to all the angels, but his gaze seems to fal most upon Dylan. She notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's still a problem. Whoever kidnapped me wasn't just trying to screw up our IPO. They also stole the proprietary software for our new web browser. I'm sure it was Roger Corwin, but I need proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you come in, Angels. CIRCLING AROUND, we see the video images of Corwin and th Red Star Systems logo on the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to break into Red Star's computer systems to see if Mr. Knox's software is indeed being converted for Red Star's use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as easy as that, Natalie. Red Star's headquarters are as tightly guarded as a military facility. We're going to need reconnaissance on their mainframe computer system, and the best way to get that is through Mr. Corwin himself.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A video image of Corwin's Palm Pilot Schedule comes up th bigscreen. The shot pulls in close on "SAN DIEGO SPEEDWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to pin a camera on him to get footage of the inside of the building. Thanks to Alex's work at the health spa, we know that Corwin will be at the San Diego Speedway on Thursday. Get close to him Angels, but don't tip your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, I need you to arrange for Mr. Knox's security. I'd hate to have him kidnapped again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. But we'd all feel safer if you could join us, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Charlie's P.O.V., looking up at the sunlight.      T manta-rays swim above us. We can hear the BUBBLES from Charlie's regulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to Angels. But I'm in a bit over my head at the moment. A manta-ray swims past, super-close, letting us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A majestic craftsman in the hills, Frank Lloyd Wright mee conspicuous consumption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight beam sweeps past, revealing Dylan. With just her shoulders above the rafters, she's checking a dusty crawl space. She finds nothing suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox stands below, Dylan's boots on his shoulders. The he dig in a bit, but he's not complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good. He moves to help her down, but she does a reverse-pullup handle it by herself. She leads the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is huge. Through the floor-to-ceiling windows, w that we're up in the hills. Knox follows her as she walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got surveillance on all the windows. Don't answer the door, don't answer the phone. We continue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as big, just as beautiful. Knox, or his decorator, h great taste. Everything is top quality, but unpretentious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, stay away from the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're bullet-proof.   The last owner was paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for us. She takes a marker-sized device off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a panic button. (tosses it to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press it and one of us can be here in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever's closest. She takes her jacket off the couch, ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He tosses her the panic button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay for dinner. (preempting objections)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a pretty good cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't Mr. Knox. I'm sorry.     If you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared. Dylan is surprised by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't want to admit it, but I am. I was kidnapped once, and it wasn't fun. I know, you probably have other plans, but it would be very reassuring. Dylan looks him over. Normally, she'd be suspicious, but the guy WAS just kidnapped, and he seems sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't make me beg. I'm embarrassed already. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. She throws her coat back on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN OFF a half-played Scrabble game to find Dylan and Knox at the windows. Dylan picks up a family photo, Knox as a little boy with a father in a military uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's you, hunh? Cute kid.    Cute family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (taking the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only picture I have of me with my parents. They died a week later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Oh, I'm sorry. I had no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't apologize. I was too young to understand. (looking at the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew how they died. When I was a kid, when I got shuffled from one foster home to another, I always thought they just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only found out later, my father was in the military. He and my mother were killed while he was on assignment, somewhere in Eastern Europe. (mostly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The files were classified, but I read enough to know that he was a good man. Apparently, he was betrayed by one of his own team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   That's a lot for a kid to live with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it motivated me, losing my family. It still does. I don't take anything for granted. Dylan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy did I have you pegged wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to be honest, I thought you were a rich kid who inherited everything. But that's pretty typical. I've got instincts for the job, but when it comes to men? Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you don't see me as just a client. He brushes his hand against hers.     She brushes back, f against fingers. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Well, you ARE, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there someone you need to be going home to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I... He kisses her. After a moment, she breaks off. It's not t it was a bad kiss. It was a damn good kiss. It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't. Knox moves towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you? Dylan holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I shouldn't. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for dinner, Mr. Knox.    And lock the door behind me. She gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: FORMULA-ONE RACE CARS
dialogues.text: ROARING past on the track.       It's all thunder, smoke asphalt. We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR, another blur of racers whips past, with heat and noise and speed. The lead car bears the familiar markings of RED STAR INDUSTRIES. Roger Corwin is at the wheel, steering calmly to a comfortable lead, when he is suddenly BUMPED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANOTHER BUMP sends him screeching to the left. He almost crashes, then gets back on course, just as he's passed by A SLEEK, BLACK CAR, sponsored by the SONY CORPORATION, an manned by a mysterious driver with TEXAS TORNADO inscript the helmet. We follow the black car as it pulls into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The racer pulls off her helmet as the pit crew surrounds Of course, the racer is Natalie, aka BETTY LOU HOBERT, th Tornado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the engine noise)

dialogues.speaker: NICE RACING
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Texas accent)

dialogues.speaker: AND BACK ROADS
dialogues.text: Natalie shakes out her hair, winks at the pit boss. The Pit Crew races in to make repairs. DYLAN, dressed in pit suit, kneels by Natalie's front tire. Natalie crouche down next to her so they can talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I nicked him. Should give you enough time to do the deed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Dylan steals away, heading for...

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN'S PIT CREW --
dialogues.text: Corwin is seething mad as he pulls into his pit.

dialogues.speaker: LET'S GO
dialogues.text: The pit repairs his car as Corwin is approached by anothe racer, also wearing a Red Star racing suit. He leans into Corwin's car and now we see that's it's... THE THIN MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks to you! You're supposed to be my head of security! Who is that bitch?! The Thin Man peers over at Natalie, but she's got her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know.   I'll keep an eye out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   You do that. Corwin peels out onto the track again, almost crushing the Thin Man in the process.

dialogues.speaker: AS CORWIN PULLS OUT
dialogues.text: Dylan sneaks in. In all the cacophony, no one notices as she grabs CORWIN'S SUITCASE out of the back seat of his regular car, a bitching Mercedes. She checks both ways to see if she's being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast is clear, Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Alex, dressed as a trophy girl, watches the race through binoculars and keeps an eye on her pals. She nods to BOSLEY, who is dressed as the Flag Waver. He speaks into a walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's make the switch.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE PIT --
dialogues.text: Dylan pulls a briefcase out of her jumpsuit, and swaps it with one in Corwin's car. She carefully switches all his files from the old briefcase to the new one, then gives Alex a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE BACK IN THE RACE --
dialogues.text: NATALIE roars back onto the track, keeping Corwin in her sights. Then she spots another Red Star car, coming up right next to her. She locks eyes with the Thin Man. The two of them recognize each other at the exact same instant.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Thin Man, realizing he's been made, jams on the brakes and skids off to the right, which leads to a ramp that heads out of the stadium. Natalie, not wanting to lose him, does something crazy. Even though she's at the front of the pack, she brakes hard, swerves into a full 180 degree U-turn, and starts heading the WRONG WAY on the race track. Startled drivers pull off to the left and right as she follows the Thin Man out of the racetrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a chorus of CAR HORNS, the Thin Man's blue racer weave through the spectator traffic entering the speedway. Looking back, we see Natalie is gaining on him. Finally clear of the traffic, both cars let it rip.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER VIDEO FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Looking down on a freeway, where a ubiquitous police pursuit is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're just joining us, we're approaching hour five of a pursuit that has lead us all across the Southland, at speeds up to 80 miles an hour. A beat-up gray Chrysler leads a phalanx of police cars down the empty freeway. It's oddly calm and hypnotizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, time and again we hear the question, "Why don't the police just ram the other car, or shoot out the tires?" The LAPD has a policy of hanging back and following unless... Suddenly, the blue Formula One car comes screeching past the cops and the suspect, over 200 miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hot on the Thin Man's tail, Natalie has the engine ROARING.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As she passes the police cars, we see several OFFICERS look over -- what the hell? Natalie catches up to the gray Chrysler. Looks over to see the WILD-EYED SUSPECT, hunched over the wheel. He looks back at her. A beat later, she's passed him, just taillights on the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the lanes cleared for the other chase, there is nothing preventing the Formula One cars from hitting top speed -- which they do. Natalie is catching up to the Thin Man. As they head under an overpass, we see KIDS CHEERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
