dialogues.text: The Thin Man checks his gauges. The gas dial is perilousl close to empty -- these cars are meant to be refilled oft Up ahead, he sees an exit.   He starts to slow down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but when you're going 200 miles per hour, that can take a while. He misses the exit. Natalie is trying to match his speed. The Thin Man pulls over to the side, stops fully. Braking as hard as she can, Natalie still passes him. The Thin Man throws a U-turn, heading up the freeway on-r Natalie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch glimpses behind fences and between train cars -- the two racers gliding slowly down the narrow roads, like lions pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling off her helmet, Natalie scans right and left for the blue car -- she's lost sight of him. The narrow windshields of these racers doesn't make it any easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We LOOK DOWN on Natalie's car as she rounds a corner, still searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie spots the blue racer reaching the end of the long pier. It pulls a U-turn to face her, then stops, engine idling. There's only way off the pier, and it's past Natalie. The Thin Man REVS his engine. Natalie REVS hers. ANGLE ON a white seagull, pecking at something on the pier, halfway between the two racers. The bird looks up, hearing the engines. ANGLE ON the Thin Man. He pulls his harness tighter. REVS his engine higher. ANGLE ON Natalie. If it's a game of chicken he wants, she'll give it to him. She REVS her engine higher still. The noise scares the bird, who suddenly flies off. Like a flag being dropped, that's the signal for both racers to peel out. A cloud of SMOKE.    Rubber on asphalt. Already reaching a tremendous speed, the racers are on a collision course. The Thin Man isn't going to turn away. Neither is Natalie. Racing faster, and faster still, there's only one way this can turn out. But then, at the very last moment, the Thin Man wusses out. He cuts the wheel right, missing Natalie and careening off the edge of the pier. In SLOW MOTION, we watch as his racer hangs in mid-air, wheels still spinning. Back-heavy, the tail hits the water first. Natalie brakes hard, cuts the wheel to avoid going off the far end of the pier. She finally stops, the rear tire just 1/4 inch from the edge. CRANING UP along the side of the pier, we find Natalie looking into the water where the blue racer went in. There's just a slick of oil and a steady stream of bubble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see lots of hallways, doorways and security locks, all from the POV of a man's hip. The footage is from the camera in the switched briefcase that Corwin is now carrying with him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK from the video to see we are actually watching it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... on the big screen. The angels and Bosley watch the footage, along with Knox and Vivian Wu. Vivian has seated herself close to Natalie. So close, in fact, that Natalie keeps having to shift a few inches. Dylan, meanwhile, sits across the room from Knox, deliberately avoiding eye contact. ON THE BIG SCREEN: As the videocamera passes a room marked with an intimidating warning sign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! VIDEO FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the room with the mainframe. Everything at Red Star goes through that system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if we want to find proof that Red Star stole Knox's technology, that's the computer to tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. But they have heavy firewalls and encryption. You can't jack in from outside. You'll have to physically be in that room to get at the data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we do get inside, there won't be time to search for it. There's got to be a hundred terabytes of information there. It could take days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you install a transmitter. All eyes go over to Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patch in directly to the relay, broadcast on a high frequency. That way, you can have access to the mainframe from the comfort of your own home. And they have no idea that you can peek inside.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Knox is impressed.    The other angels nod.   It's a good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all fine in theory. But you still have to get inside that room to install it. What about security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Star has a lot of Government contracts, so security is tight. Key- card badges throughout. Redundant security at all red-line areas with biometric scanners and weekly keycodes. Pervasive video surveillance, lasers, air-displacement sensors. Plus a hard- wired fail-safe at the relay to prevent exactly this kind of tapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds impossible. Alex checks with her fellow angels.    They're in agreeme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like fun. With a subtle RUSH, we move into a stylized MONTAGE that shows How They Do It. It features WHIP PANS, FREEZE FRAMES and ZOOMS to show us only the highlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the two directors can disengage the fail-safe. We have to get their keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON DIRECTOR #1, 40's, part of the lunchtime crowd. Alex and Natalie are on the catwalk, in the middle of a grinding routine. Paying for his drink, he fumbles with his wallet. His waitress helps him find the right bill. As she walks away, we see the waitress is Dylan. FREEZE F We ZOOM IN on the orange key-card she's grabbed from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Bosley, done up in full clown makeup. He tries to twist a balloon animal, but no luck. Finally it POPS. The CHILDREN CRY. Entertaining the ADULTS, magician Alex whips open her sil handkerchief to reveal that the "item" has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON DIRECTOR #2, who looks very worried. Magician's assistant Dylan takes off her giant hat to reveal the dir billfold is underneath. Getting it back, he's relieved. Passing behind Dylan, Natalie takes the orange keycard Dylan hands off. FREEZE FRAME. ZOOM IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we have to get back into Red Star. Problem is, their biometric sensors are too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need someone's help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Roger Corwin, driving his Mercedes.     He slows a road crew working ahead. ANGLE ON Dylan, dressed in an orange vest, manning the slow/stop sign. She makes Corwin stop, leans in to apologize for the delay. Behind the Mercedes, Natalie sneaks up. She quickly picks the trunk lock, then quietly climbs in. She hoists in a large duffel bag, then shuts herself inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the car moving again. Stripped down to a bra, Natalie attaches an illuminated m to the underside of the trunk lid. Starts to pull more it from her duffel bag: black shoes, a dress shirt, a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. We see Corwin's Mercedes pull into the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking away from the car, Corwin hits the remote.    The Mercedes BWOOPS. A beat later, a hand comes out from under the trunk lid. Natalie climbs out, only she's not Natalie anymore. She's become Corwin -- identical to the last detail. She tucks the last of the latex mask under her collar as she walks. FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corwin puts his right hand on the sensor grid.    A laser scans it. Approved. The Security Guard hits the button, releasing the gate. He goes back to his magazine as Corwin passes through. A beat, then... A VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy? You gonna let me through or what? Tommy the Guard looks up, sees Corwin is still at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.     Yeah, sorry Mr. Corwin. He hits the button again, letting Corwin through. Tommy goes back to his magazine, still a little perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same places we saw on the videotape. Natalie-as- Corwin swipes the two stolen failsafe cards in a reader, sending the lights from red to green. FREEZE FRAME. She splices in a transmitter the size of a cigarette pack Pulls up a tiny antenna. FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corwin walks down the hall, still talking with his colleague. Natalie-as-Corwin is walking right towards them. She turns away as she passes. He didn't even spot her. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a group, the angels move through the upscale lunch crowd to find Knox and Vivian Wu at a booth. Alex opens a slim Sony laptop, sets it on the table. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. Red Star's mainframe is open for business.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Astonished, Vivian Wu hits some keys, checking that what they say is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a passing waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Champagne, please. Your best. Smiling, Knox motions for them to take a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know why I hired you.   You're the best. A look between the angels.      They know it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Knox, re: laptop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have Systems get to work on this right away. She reaches for the laptop.      Bosley snatches it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, actually Miss Wu, WE will get to work on this right away. Any evidence we find will be turned over to you AND the proper authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand how important that data is, Mr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, indeed I do. And that's why I'll take very good care of it when I find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for the laptop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, please. Do as the man says. Reluctantly, Vivian Wu pulls her hand away. Bosley tucks the laptop into a steel briefcase, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you off to, Bos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, lemme guess. You're off to chase bikinis at some tropical resort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!   Fire Island, here I come! Dylan does a spit take, the other two Angels roll their e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Angels. Mr. Knox. (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Wu. As Bosley exits the restaurant, Vivian Wu eyes him carefully. Knox raises a glass to toast the Angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More champagne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to go.   Plans tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. As they get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dylan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? She notices the other Angels staring at her.        She d at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... well... Natalie quickly picks up what's going on.        She glan Alex, then clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dylan, can we talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: THE LADIES ROOM
dialogues.text: Natalie, Alex, and Dylan kibbitz near the sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something going on between you and Knox. Isn't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, so I like him.   Is that so wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah Dylan, it IS.    He's a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAS a client.    We finished the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She doesn't have ANY point, Alex, I can't believe you're siding with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not siding with anyone, but technically, he is no longer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Charlie would NEVER approve of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, Charlie wouldn't care. I think you're just being overly cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, guys?   GUYS! They turn to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a big girl. I make my own decisions. I'm going out with him. She walks out of the ladies' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley hums "In the Navy" to himself as he walks through a parking garage. He's alone in the echo-y garage, and everything we know about movies tells us This Means Troub BWEEP BWEEP as his alarm shuts off. Just as he's about to lift the handle, he stops. Looks back over his shoulde Did he hear something? He scans the empty garage. one in sight. Must've been his imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley climbs in, shutting the door behind him.        He putting the keys in the ignition, when... A HAND clamps a chloroformed rag over his mouth. It's the Thin Man. Bosley struggles, but in moments, he's unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: THE THIN MAN stuffs Bosley in the trunk, slams it shut, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams. Vivian Wu, standing beside the Thin Man. She's holding the case Bosley refused to give her before. THE THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, now we have the transmitter, what do we do with fat boy? Dirt nap time? VIVIAN WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! Not until I've got the information I need. We'll take him to the compound, hold him there. (beat) In the meantime, we've got to tie up some loose ends. THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you say something like that, it means more work for me. VIVIAN WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) The Angels will figure out they were duped. We can't afford them jeopardizing our plans. THE THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes... VIVIAN WU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) We have to Kill Charlie's Angels. The Thin Man sighs, whips out his cell phone. THE THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'll cancel my weekend plans. And speaking of weekend plans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Alex are walking down a beautiful, tree-lined cobblestone street, holding hands. The buildings and outdoor cafes are reminiscent of a quaint, vaguely European town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, I can't tell you how happy I am you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, it's weird. It's weirding me out how happy I am when you're around. Am I sick or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only bummer is, I start to jones when you're not around. What the hell am I gonna do this weekend, if you're not with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get you some sedatives. You'll be fine. He stops, takes her in his arms. With the moonlight shining down, it's very romantic. They kiss. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   Wait a second.   Come with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami, on the Sony Jet. I've got two tickets to the Final Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, before you say no, let me just say something, okay? I'm sick of how little we see each other. I'm sick of stealing a day here, or a week there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job, Jason. I can't explain it, but I have to be on call, all the time, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I changed all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you to quit your job, and come live with me. What I'm saying, Alex, is that I want you to... BLAM!    BLAM!   Gunshots ring out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire!   Get down! Alex, in Angels mode, immediately throws him to the ground and covers him. She feels something wet, looks down to see Jason's chest, covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you're hit. You're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I'm fine. (he laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're squibs, it's fake.   See? He wipes off a little, puts it on her tongue.     Finally convinced, she almost lets herself laugh.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: that we are in a soundstage, the cobblestones street is just a set. The gunfire was coming from some effects guys, who are test firing guns for the upcoming action scene just outside the soundstage, visible through the open loading door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake guns, too. They're just setting up for the next scene. He helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I loved that. The way you yelled and everything? Baby, you been watching too many movies. (he kisses her on the nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I gotta go reset these. DON'T GO ANYWHERE. I want to finish this conversation. As he walks out of the soundstage, Alex is left behind, alone. She cleans herself off, shaking her head at her own paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, Alex.   Real nice.

dialogues.speaker: THIPP
dialogues.text: A wall next to her sprays a cloud of plaster.     Alex lo at the hole. That's strange.

dialogues.speaker: THIP, THIP
dialogues.text: Two more little explosions, these barely missing her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is someone firing more squibs or... Suddenly, without warning, the wall is plastered with SILENCED GUNFIRE. It's only Alex's instincts that let her duck in time to avoid being turned into Swiss cheese. She tucks and rolls behind a Styrofoam set as... TWO GUNMEN with silenced SNIPER rifles fan out on the fake city street.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALEX --
dialogues.text: crouched behind a wall. She looks both ways. If she tries to break for the open loading door, she'll lead the gunmen right back to Jason. Only way out of here is to head for the far wall, all the way across the building, where there's a fire exit. Taking a deep breath, she darts across the fake street.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: fire at her, one of them pulling off his silencer and goi to machine gun mode. The sound of the gunshots are covere by the sound of the effects guy, test firing guns outside

dialogues.speaker: ALEX --
dialogues.text: Sees that the sets are held up by wooden support beams. She lifts her leg and delivers a solid blow, cracking the two-by-fours in half.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: move slowly through the fake street set. Suddenly, they hear a creaking sound. They look up to see the whole, fake building set collapsing! They dive out of the way, just in time to see Alex race through the fire doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex races out of the soundstage and jumps into her car, parked nearby. The Gunmen emerge from the stage and spot her, just as she gets the car started. She peels out as a hail of gunfire just misses her windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason has just gotten his squibs refitted. He's facing the opposite direction, so he doesn't see Alex's car whizz away in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason walks into the Soundstage, followed by the effects

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?     ALEX? Of course, she's nowhere to be found. While he looks around, one of the effects guys fingers a bullet hole in the set wall. He presses against it and a FLATTENED BULLET FALLS OUT. He thinks for a moment, then shakes his head.   Couldn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passing FILMGOER reveals Natalie and Pete. Seated near the aisle, they share a giant tub of popcorn. The movie hasn't started yet, but there's a slide show of various anime heroes and villains. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the second chance. I swear, I'm really not a flake. He shrugs it off. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I deny any woman who's seen all 23 "Lords of Wind and Power"? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet there's a dozen women here who fit that description. She's right. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly -- there's a looks component as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the most beautiful woman I've ever seen this close up. How can she not be flattered by that? She would say something back, but the moment has gotten so electrified that each little glance just brings on more goofy-in- loveness. The only solution is to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies room.    I'll be back in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wee bit smitten, Natalie enters as the last WOMAN leave We hear just the DRIP DRIP DRIP of a faucet and the Muzak version of Power Station's "Some Like It Hot."

dialogues.speaker: IN A STALL
dialogues.text: Natalie shuts the door behind herself, then sets to work putting down a tissue-paper seat cover.

dialogues.speaker: SWEEPING ACROSS THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: We look under stall doors to find a pair of black men's boots stepping down from inside. Natalie is not alone.

dialogues.speaker: IN HER STALL
dialogues.text: Natalie is about to hoist her skirt when she stops. Spider Sense is tingling.

dialogues.speaker: A DOOR LATCH
dialogues.text: CLICKS open. We TILT UP to see a WELL-DRESSED MAN. at least 6'3". He stops at Natalie's stall door, drawing his gun.      A beat, then he KICKS the door open, revealing... AN EMPTY STALL. The automatic toilet FLUSHES itself.      The Man takes a half-step in, confused. Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door swings back, SMASHING into his right hand.     H drops the gun, looking up to see

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE,
dialogues.text: Who is perched atop the stall walls.     She pushed the d with her foot. Grabbing an overhead pipe, she performs an acrobatic swing, landing both feet on the guy's head. He falls into the next row of stalls. Natalie reaches for the gun, but the Man grabs her ankles He pulls her back across the tile floor, flipping her ove That just makes it easier for her to kick him where it co With a scissors lock around his neck, Natalie is pulled up while the Man falls. She lands a knee on his windpipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you work for? He tries to pull her off.    She leans in harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak now or never again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning with eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket pocket. Suspicious, she digs inside his coat to pull out a leathe billfold. Flips it open to reveal an I.D. that reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Security Agency?   You're with the NSA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been following you. I didn't know which side you were on. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bigger than you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anime classic is playing. Pete keeps looking back towards the door. He's been ditched again. Just when he's about to give up hope, Natalie is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, but I have to go. I can't explain. (hands card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my cell phone number. Please call me tomorrow. Please. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With that, she goes. A beat, then she comes back. Kisses him once, hard. Then goes for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Knox walk hand in hand up a quaint, woodsy path behind Knox's home. We can hear music drifting up from the hill in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that music coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see.    Just a little farther. He helps her up a steep part of the path.       As she co over the crest of a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (taking in the view)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hill behind Knox's house has a magnificent view right into the Hollywood Bowl. The music is the symphony playing something very romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's amazing. They stand there, together, just listening to the music, Knox watching her reaction closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you know about Charlie? Dylan seems surprised by this question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just find it strange that you work for a man you've never met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what he looks like, but I feel like I know him. We all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And none of you have any clue who he actually is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're never curious to find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, but believe me, it's impossible. I've tried. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not talk about Charlie, okay? Or work. She smiles t him, motioning for them to go back up to Knox's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, let's not talk at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Knox are asleep in his bed, when the doorbell CHIMES. Dylan bolts upright. She slips out of bed, peers out the window. Vivian Wu is waiting by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, it's Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.    I wonder what she's here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to tell her to come back, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  I'd better deal. (he kisses her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go back to bed. Knox pulls on a robe, goes downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: STAY ON DYLAN --
dialogues.text: as she pulls on her clothes, her CELL PHONE rings.     Sh grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, we were set up. Vivian Wu is not who she says she is. She's a former assassin and an all around bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.   OH SHIT. Natalie, she's HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at Knox's, she just showed up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving her own highly excellent car, Natalie has it floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ten minutes away. Wait until I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. Call Alex and meet me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan... But Dylan's already hung up.     Cursing her partner, Nat races the car even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox is sitting at the coffee table, signing papers. Vivi sitting across from him, has her cell phone open. They ar both surprised to see Dylan walk into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you take your bodyguarding services seriously. Still, I worry that no one is watching the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm watching it.     In fact, I just called for back up. From her bag, Vivian pulls a silver 9MM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same, I'm concerned about Mr. Knox's safety.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Although Knox is clueless, it's clear the message Vivian is sending to Dylan. She's in control here. Vivian sets the gun on the table, in easy reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian just came over to run through some numbers for the IPO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, take a seat. I'm almost finished. With a knowing glance at Dylan, she goes back to her phone call. No alternative, Dylan takes a seat beside Knox.     Both Vivian, whose hand is very near the gun. Dylan looks at Knox as he reads through his papers.    He idea there's anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. How disappointing. Vivian gestures to the abandoned Scrabble game on the tab Why not play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not much for games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. As Knox flips pages in the report, Dylan casually begins pushing Scrabble letters around, nothing serious. But she managed to spell...

dialogues.speaker: ENEMY
dialogues.text: She gets Knox's attention, looks to the word, up to Vivia Knox follows her intention, but doesn't seem to believe i While Vivian continues to talk on the phone, Knox sets hi report down. Pushes around some letters of his own. The words finally come out as...

dialogues.speaker: I KNOW
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Dylan.      What does that mean? Vivian snaps her phone shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Knox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news: The other angels are still alive. Good news: Everything else proceeding apace. Dylan stands up.    What the hell is going on? Vivian draws the gun on her.    Knox moves over toward Vivian's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Dylan. I knew this moment would come sooner or later. I was just hoping for later. A long beat, Dylan trying to wrap her head around this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time, we thought Red Star was behind this, but it was you. (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You faked your kidnapping. Knox taps his nose.    She's got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To gain your trust. And get your help. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know, my personal attraction to you was a sincere and unrelated complication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, in that case I feel a lot better about you being a lying pole smoker. Dylan looks like she's about to leap forward and tear Kno throat out. Vivian gestures for Dylan to keep stepping ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? You trust Charlie and you've never even met him. Dylan crosses the sill, out onto the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And believe me, there's a lot about him that you don't know. Anyway, I'm not going to be an idiot and stand here talking when we could do something useful, like KILL YOU. Goodbye, Dylan, I'll miss you... How right he is, because as soon as Vivian squeezes the trigger... Dylan drops to the floor, then rolls.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: the bullet misses Dylan and slams into the bulletproof wi causing a spider-web crack to spread. Dylan sees her opportunity and heads right for the window while Vivian pumps off shots. As she comes to the window, Dylan jumps up in the air and does a flying kick, hitting right at the spot where the bullet impacted.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: The bulletproof glass shatters outward, and Dylan flies o the window, onto the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (to Vivian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen YOU do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan looks over the edge of the balcony. The drop-off is incredibly steep -- the house is built on stilts -- and t fall looks like it would kill her. But she doesn't have much choice.

dialogues.speaker: KNOX AND VIVIAN
dialogues.text: come running out onto the balcony, just in time to see Dy jump. They rush to the edge, look down into a forbidding thicket of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't have survived.   It's too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, I should probably check... Knox shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got more important things to do. The two of them head back inside.    As they do... We hold on the railing, then slowly start to drift down, the underside of the balcony. Dylan has attached her belt the bottom of the railing, and is hanging in the rafters. she pulls herself back up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black sedan pulls onto the tarmac. Knox and Vivian Wu e then hustle into a waiting private plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, Dylan and Alex nurse their wounds and compare no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Knox tried to kill me. I mean, I've been lied to, I've been cheated on, but no guy has ever tried to SHOOT me before. (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get him for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He played us from the very start. It was all just so he could get us to tap into Red Star. He couldn't figure out a way to do it himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew that we are actually tapping into the main servers for The National Security Agency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, thanks to us, he's had hours to download whatever top secret information he wants, for God knows what reason. The angels take a beat to let their indignation grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. We installed the transmitter, yes, but we never gave him the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That laptop was the only way to access the transmitter. And we gave the laptop to... They look at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley! And on that note...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN over the water to reveal the massive complex - villa, half-castle. Built into the green hills, it's flanked by oversized windmills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed guards, as if they were necessary, make sure no one goes up or down a staircase that leans up into the tower, where their dangerous prisoner is being held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley's cell, as such, is a round room. Bosley flits about in a panic. He's hardly touched the go food on his tray. Except for the pudding. He loves puddin

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: Still a-twitter, Bosley flips through the 500 channels on his big-screen TV. He watches a few moments of E!

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: As the Thin Man takes the tray away, Bosley suddenly atta him with the silverware. With a single hand to Bosley's forehead, the Thin Man holds him at arm's length, harmles He takes the weapons away.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: Bosley WHISTLES to a bright red songbird who has landed on the windowsill. The bird WHISTLES back. Bosley thinks they're having a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bosley is going a little insane.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: In his spacious bathroom, Bosley is sitting on the toilet rocking as he makes spaceman noises. We hear a PLOP in the water, and then a BLEEP BLEEP. Curious, he stands up and looks in the bowl.      He's su by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is on the phone, frantically dialing numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bosley, answer. (she hangs up, then, to the Angels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried all his numbers and paged him five times. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even want to think about what I'm thinking right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!  He's alive, he's gotta be.   If... (she pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What IS that? There's a very faint voice coming from Bosley's desk draw Dylan walks around the desk, yanks it open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels!   Angels, can you hear me! Dylan grabs the radio receiver from the drawer, holds him Bosley's voice gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you can hear me. I don't know if this thing is even working. The Angels crowd around Dylan and the receiver.     It se impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a satellite mini-dish mounted to the roof. We CR DOWN to look in a tower window, where Bosley is hunched o the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the top of the TV, a wire runs from the satellite feed

dialogues.speaker: THE TINY RADIO
dialogues.text: that Bosley swallowed at the spa.   It's worked its way through his system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can't answer, but... I really hope you can hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angels still can't believe they're hearing his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we trace him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not off a boosted signal. We'd have to be within 20 miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bosley. Tell us where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where I am, really. I'm in a round room. The walls are white. Well. Not white-white. More of a cream, or an eggshell. Vanilla. Yes, I'm going to say vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. Dylan finds a globe amid the wreckage.     Wipes off the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know which ocean. I was blindfolded the whole time. We were flying. It must've been three or four hours. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With her fingers, Dylan figures out how far he could have flown. Estimates the circumference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be anywhere in North America. The bird Bosley was whistling to lands on the TV, looks at the transmitter, curious. SINGS its song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever it is, they have really good pudding. Natalie holds up a finger -- stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, pudding? The bird SINGS its song again.      Natalie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that? That's a blue spotted egret. They only live in one place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florida. The MUSIC revs up, as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HELICOPTER touches down inside the villa gates.     Kno and Vivian emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox and Vivian walk into a fully macked computer room, where the Thin Man is supervising a techie as he taps awa at Bosley's laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our access was cut off at the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not before we retrieved the information you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Thin Man pulls a piece of paper out of a printer, hands them to Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Security Agency's secret file on the man known as Charles Townsend. Knox smiles.    Takes the print-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Bosley? Did we get the information we wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we we drugged him, he sang like a bird. The Thin Man hands Knox another print-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Miami Arena.    Preparations have been made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    We move out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where IS Bosley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the tower. We were waiting till you gave the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?    No time like the present. The Thin Man nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thin Man cocks his gun as he heads to the tower to do away with Bosley. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?    You should take a look at this. The Henchman leads Thin Man into...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY ROOM
dialogues.text: A room lined with monitors that survey the courtyard. Hen points to one in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See here? Look at the timer on the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not moving. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is the oldest one in the book. Punch up camera three. Another camera angle comes up, this also a view of the empty courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pan left. The Henchman does what he's told and, on the monitor... WE SEE DYLAN, dressed in a black cat suit, as she rewires a security camera. She glances around, making sure no one sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old re-loop the video camera trick. And look, she's not even carrying a gun. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, amateur hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan sneaks her way through the courtyard, doing an admirable job of trying to stick to the walls. As she comes around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, excuse me?     I think you're trespassing. She whips around to see the Thin Man, standing right behind her. She instantly swings at him, he blocks it. She's about to swing again when five guns get cocked against her temple. She's surrounded by guards.

dialogues.speaker: NOW --
dialogues.text: The thin man and his boys lead Dylan into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, but as "storming the castle" plans go, this one sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And I suppose you could do better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I sure as hell could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about an underwater entry? Or hang gliding over the main tower? There's a million good ways in, if you just do your homework. Dylan glares at him, and as she does... We move in CLOSE ON Dylan's funky belt buckle.       Ther tiny camera concealed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Alex huddle around a three-inch monitor, getting live video from Dylan's camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Dyl. They move into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan is led inside by the Thin Man.       Knox is waitin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, how nice. Welcome to my Florida home. Not as tasteful as the one in LA, but much more private. She shrugs off the goons -- enough already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, Knox, what's the brilliant plan? You gonna sell a list of our foreign spies to the highest bidder? Blackmail the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first plan is too complicated, and the second is virtually impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I already have all the money I need and my motivation is much simpler... (leaning in close to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge?   Against who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I'm not in a gabby mood right now. I've got a score to settle. He flips shut a suitcase filled with C-5 explosive, the same stuff we saw Pascal selling in the opening scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like you're going a bit overboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just leaving myself plenty of margin for error. Goodbye, Dylan. With that, he walks out of the room. The Thin Man signals to the Henchmen. Two of them force Dylan to sit in one of the wooden deck chairs. Then, with the thick packing tape, they begin binding her arms to the arms of the chair. As they do:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you bother.   I've already won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first. (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be the guy behind me. The Thin Man can't help but be amused. After all, there are six guards and one blonde -- who is now taped to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised. (nods to the second guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll take the chair seat in the chin. (re: two others; very slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... I'm warning both of you: I'm going to get you to shoot each other. I know. Cliche as that sounds. (then to the last two)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last, you guys -- hell, I'll make something up. We'll have fun. The Thin Man smirks oh-so-confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what will you do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't even be here. I mean, I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but you should've killed me by now. Because I already know that your people are onto my people, which means any moment now you're going to be called out to go and deal -- Suddenly the door flies open and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!   See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have intruders. With a glare to Dylan, the Thin Man follows him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, dressed in a sexy bikini, emerges from the water and instantly takes out two guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATALIE hang-glides into a courtyard, knocking out two henchmen as she does. Alex catches up with her, as Natalie pulls out a small scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley's close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find him.    I'll get Dylan. Natalie heads left.     Alex goes right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing up the stairs, Natalie enters a round room with open windows on all sides. A gentle breeze stirs the curtains. There's an amazing 360 degree view, from hills to ocean. According to her scanner, Bosley should be here, but there's no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOSLEY! Bosley, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOSLEY'S ROUND ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: Hearing her voice, the feral Bosley looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie!   Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears him. She keeps yelling -- so does he -- until they both realize that his room is above hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get up to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a staircase. Look for a switch. She begins frantically checking the desk, the shelves, everything. Her cell phone RINGS.     She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Pete, hi! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On break, Pete is talking on a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. I just -- you said you wanted me to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie keeps checking the shelves, looking for a secret switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I do.    I mean, thank you for calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an insecure person or anything, and I've really enjoyed the very brief time we have spent together. Two GOONS race up the stairs into the office.   Natalie turns to face them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just wondering if it's something I said or did that's making this whole thing so weird between us. The Goons approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hold on a sec? Hitting MUTE, Natalie kicks the chair behind her and dive under the desk. She comes up on the other side with a

dialogues.speaker: SURGE SUPPRESSOR,
dialogues.text: electric cords attached. She backhands it into the goons, who jerk and twitch as electricity shoots through their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (un-muting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more sec. She re-mutes. With a roundhouse kick, she flattens one of the goons, WHACKS the other with the cell phone. The first goon charges at her, but she sidesteps at the last moment, leaving Goon One to hit Goon Two. Both men topple through the open window, falling. Yikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (un-muting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, is this a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Not at all. She starts searching again for the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sound distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, work this week has been really busy. It's been hard to focus. BEHIND NATALIE, Vivian Wu reaches the top of the stairs. She moves stealthily. Natalie has no idea she's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the thing is, I'm not a full- time waitress. I should have been more up-front about that, it's just... At the last moment, Natalie catches a moving reflection in a shiny trophy. Turns to find Vivian Wu swinging an antique chair at her head. She ducks.    The chair SHATTERS the display case. Scrambling to get away, Natalie drops the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to disagree. Vivian upends the desk, nearly crushing Natalie. Vivian jumps on top, ready to kick the shit out of our angel. As we probably suspected, Vivian Wu is one hell of a martial artist. Fortunately, so is Natalie. In their first series of blows, Vivian seems to have the upper hand, but Natalie rallies hard. Vivian surprises her with a floor-sweeping kick, knocking her down. Vivian grabs the phone off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the famous Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's Pete. Vivian looks at the phone. Who the fuck cares?      She throws the phone out the open window. Getting up, Natalie stares her down, incredulity building to rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch!   I like that guy. Mocking, Vivian wipes away a tear. Natalie lets forth a typhoon of fury, a full-out Mortal Kombat. Vivian is thrown back against the bookcase, where she knocks over a candlestick. That's the trigger for the bookcases to begin sinking into the floor. Circling around the room, each set of shelves drops to a different level, forming steps that lead to the upstairs room. As Natalie and Vivian continue to fight, Bosley sticks his head down from above, watching the brawl. Natalie is kicking ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vivian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how difficult it is to find a quality man in Los Angeles? She slams Vivian into the wall.      Grabs her again, han around her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest? Vivian suddenly leans forward and KISSES her, right on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Natalie is surprised for a moment, which gives Vivian the chance to swing at her. She misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle villainy. I can even handle super-villainy. (Vivian swings and misses again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what you did is just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She head-butts Vivian, knocking her out cold.   She throw the limp body on the floor. A beat, then Natalie looks up to see Bosley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly chipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bos! He waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From below, we hear SECURITY WHISTLES. The compound has b breached. Dylan looks at the six armed guards surrounding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. And now she does exactly what she told the Thin Man she'd She pitches forward, ducking her head so the chair's back crashes into the railing, tearing it off. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that part worked. The Guards FIRE -- but Dylan has already launched herself from the railing into that backflip, which lands her on the head of -- Fat Boy, flattening him bad, and smashing the rest of the chair into kindling. She grabs the wooden seat and whips it up, catching bullets from Guard #3 before flinging it like a Frisbee at Guard #2, nailing him right on the chin Quickly she stands again, between Guards #3 and 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, guys, I warned you. This is where you shoot each other. The two men scoff, disbelieving. Then Dylan does a head fake, both Guards panic, and fire, but Dylan drops, leavi each man a clear shot at the other. Both gape. Both fall. Just Guards #5 and 6 left.    Dylan's chair arms are stil taped to her forearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's where we improvise. In a whirl, she overhead-chops Guard #5. Drives her right arm into his shoulder while swinging her left arm into the back of the Guard #6's head.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A few more blows, then both men fall. Now Dylan drops into a second chair, half-exhausted, half-amused with herself. Has one brief beat to take it all in, then -- Bosley steps onto the veranda, sees Dylan sitting in the chair. FROM HIS POINT OF VIEW: It looks like Dylan -- whose arms are still strapped to the arms of the first chair -- is taped to the chair she now sits in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, let me help you. Bosley hurries over, "freeing her." Amused, Dylan lets him. Natalie steps out from inside, pausing to KICK one guard who was starting to revive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox, carrying the briefcase bomb, gets into his waiting helicopter, followed closely by the Thin Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's GO! The helicopter quick ascends, just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE ANGELS
dialogues.text: run into the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. He's got a pound of C-5 in that briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is, where's he headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami. The three angels turn to see Bosley, huffing and puffing his way into the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man Knox is trying to kill has two general admission tickets to the Duke- Maryland game at Miami Arena. He's going to blow up the arena and kill his target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I don't believe you, but how exactly do you know all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Angels, I was the one who purchased those tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bosley, you HATE sports, why would you... (suddenly getting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't buy them for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bought them for... Bosley lowers his head.    Suddenly all the angels unders

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: They race out the courtyard, in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing across the water, we find thong-clad BEACH BABES moving to a Latin beat. Art Deco buildings flank sun-kiss streets. The people are sexy, the daiquiris strong, and e night's a fiesta -- Welcome to MIAMI. Running down the street, towards Miami Arena, the three angels pass THREE OTHER WOMEN rollerblading by: JILL MONROE, SABRINA DUNCAN and KELLY GARRETT. Nothing is said, but a cool moment just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Angels are running down a very long hallway. Their voices are the only sound that echoes off these walls, although there is a faint humming that grows loude as they approach two, metal fire doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think he looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty, tall, well-built.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always saw him as younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.   With black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, silver hair. And tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not George Hamilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's outside a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll know him when we see him, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IF we see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard can it be to spot Charlie? They slam into the doors, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reverse angle to reveal the inside of Miami Arena. The thing that hits us is the WALL OF SOUND, the noise made by twenty thousand people in a basketball induced frenzy. The next thing that hits us is the sheer magnitude of the job facing the Angels. Hard to spot? The crowd is one, enormous, teeming mass of brightly colored humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, shit. The game is in progress, Duke vs. North Carolina, and it' barn burner. A one point game with six minutes to go. BAL PLAYER pulls up and swishes a three pointer, Duke by two. The crowd goes apeshit.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE MEZZANINE
dialogues.text: The Angels huddle, yelling over the deafening noise of th crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to split up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the luxury boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the mezzanine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the floor. They split up. Dylan leads the charge down the loge secti blowing past the SECURITY WOMAN, who yells after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND THE RIM, COLLEGE PLAYER #2 pulls down a brick, sla home the rebound. The crowd ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON GIBBONS, famous movie star and North Carolina alumn pumps his fists in the air. His luxury box is loaded with fellow Tar Heels and nameless studio executives. He repeatedly high fives a Hollywood type in sunglasses and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes! When suddenly, the door to the luxury box is flung open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!? Charles Townsend! Jason whips around and locks eyes with Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Realizing she has no time to explain, and that Charlie is in here, she turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX!    Hey... While everyone watches, confused, Jason pushes his way through the box and follows Alex into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan races past rows of seats, pissing off plenty of fan in the process. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking everywhere) Charlie! Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: FLASHES FIRE
dialogues.text: in the stands.

dialogues.speaker: STATISTICIANS
dialogues.text: scribble at their monitors. Natalie runs behind them, scanning the crowd. WHIP PANS, from ONE MAN to ANOTHER to ANOTHER. Stopping on a likely candidate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOREBOARD CLOCK
dialogues.text: counts down.    :60.   :59.    :58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex bursts in.   It's a crowd of fifteen cocktail-drinki BUSINESS MEN. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Townsend? Anybody, Charles Townsend? She ducks back into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks out into the hallway, frustrated.     Then, miraculously, she spots him... KNOX. He walks out of one of the luxury boxes, holding a large, metal briefcase. He heads for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: immediately goes to intercept him, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's the Thin Man, standing behind her, with a gun in her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You move, you say anything, I perforate you. Got it? Knox glances back at the Thin Man, nods to him.      Then gets in the elevator. The Thin Man starts edging Alex towards some emergency ex doors, gun still in her back. Alex is trying to think of escape, quickly. She knows that the second he gets her ou of this public space, he's gonna shoot her. The door gets closer and closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?!   Jesus, what is going on? The Thin Man and Alex turn around to face Jason, who is sweaty and exasperated from chasing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, hi, I... The Thin Man digs the gun deeper into her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can talk to me NOW. I want to know what the hell is going on. First, you disappear with no explanation, not even a goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I see you here, but you're with some other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, movie star, do yourself a favor and get lost. Jason double takes.     He's not used to someone talking him like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess.   You must be Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no I'm sick of this shit. I'm sick of this asshole telling you what you can and can't do. And then, with no warning, he hauls off and punches the Thin Man. Now, Jason's just an actor, not an ass-kicking super detective, so his punch isn't all that great. In fact, it leaves Jason shaking his hand in pain. The Thin Man, a trickle of blood running from his lip, sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was stupid. First, he pops Jason right in the jaw. Jason stumbles backward, dazed. Then he reaches for his gun, in the process, loosening his grip on Alex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, get down! Alex spins out of the Thin Man's grasp and does a full roundhouse kick, knocking the gun out of the Thin Man's hands. The Thin Man immediately responds, throwing two quick punches, which Alex expertly blocks and then follow with a hitch-kick to the chin. Jason, dazed and confused, thinks he must be hallucinatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? What's going on is a world class ass-kicking, courtesy of girlfriend. While the action star watches in amazement, A unloads an arsenal of bad ass kung fu moves that would ma Jet Li green with envy. The Thin Man doesn't stand a chance. A flying side kick sends him stumbling backwards into the stairwell. We follow the fight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to the first landing. The Thin Man, battered and brui reaches down to his ankle holster to get his spare gun, b Alex is too fast for him. She stamps on his hand, then drops a knee to his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, just by leaning forward, I could crush your windpipe. You'd die a slow and painful death. You don't want that, do you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Thin Man shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the bomb, when's it going off? She presses harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason slams out into the stairwell, looking for Alex. He finds her on her walkie talkie, the Thin Man handcuffed to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jason.   Gimme one second? Jason nods, sure. We go to another triptych, all three Angels on their cell phones in different parts of arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels! Knox planted the bomb in the basement, and it's timed to go off when the game clock hits zero!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, Alex, I'll stop the clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look for the bomb! Alex turns back to Jason. He's clearly having a difficult time processing everything he's just seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied to you Jason.    I'm not a secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the Thin Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that wasn't Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually here to stop a madman from killing everyone in this building. Would it be okay if we talked later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go save the world, honey. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting for you. Alex smiles.    Runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie stares up at the clock... :30.       :29. The WHISTLE BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time out! Whew, that was close. But it'll start up any second. has to keep it stopped. But how? She glances to the sidelines and gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COURT --
dialogues.text: MUSIC starts from overhead, the respective teams' cheerle coming out for one last routine. As they kick into gear, Natalie comes out with them, dres as a Duke cheerleader. She follows along with the dancers bit timid at first, then more confident as she gets into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan races through the basement, looking for the briefca Then she spots it, hooked into some wires that snake up into ceiling above. Dylan approaches it cautiously.       She slowly opens th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Dylan, all we have to do is figure out which wire to cut.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL THE BOMB --
dialogues.text: there are about fifty different wires, in every color in the Crayola box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, still searching for Charlie, notices something stra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: is fully transformed on the court, from wallflower to ful out cheerleader. It's not that she's as good as the other cheerleaders. She's better.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COURT
dialogues.text: The SONG ends. The Cheerleaders vacate the court, but Nat keeps dancing her heart out. She has 18,000 fans watching her, and she's totally in the moment. But there's another agenda as well... COURTSIDE RADIO ANNOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time out is over, but one cheerleader doesn't seem to notice. Officials can't start the clock again while she's on the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan has picked two wires. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chartreuse and magenta.   This has gotta be it. She prepares to snip them with her wire cutters, when... KNOX (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that, if I were you. She spins to see Knox, standing behind her. KNOX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, if you snip ANY of those wires, the bomb WILL blow up. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna blow anyway, once the clock gets to zero. KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that, my idiotic henchman? Do you think I tell him ANYTHING that's confidential? He holds up a small TRIGGERING DEVICE. It's the same one we saw Pascal try to sell in the opening scene. KNOX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS is what triggers that bomb.     So if you'll kindly step away, I'll refrain from killing both of us.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Realizing she has no choice, Dylan stands up and backs aw KNOX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In different circumstances, Dylan, I think you and I could have worked out. We have a lot in common. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I fall for assholes, and you ARE one. Knox laughs. KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one. (beat, as he backs up) Well, I must be going. If you like your body parts attached to your torso, I suggest you do the same. Knox turns to go, but the other Angels are blocking his w ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, Knox. You're surrounded. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us the detonator. KNOX

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Stumbling backwards, Knox holds it up high. KNOX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll blow this building sky high, I swear! CHARLIE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Eric. It's me you want, not all these innocent people. Everyone turns, as one, to a figure emerging from the sha KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie? That's right, it's Charlie. Finally, after all these year we get a look at him, and boy is it... disappointing. He's not what we expected. Short, portly, dressed in a "We're #1" t-shirt; the Angels are absolutely floored by Charlie's appearance. ANGELS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie? Charlie ignores their stares and addresses Knox directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a double agent, Eric. Yes, I revealed him, but he was killed by his own people before we could throw him in jail. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still your fault, you arrogant prick! You still killed my father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe I did. But why should YOU kill all these people? If you hate me so much, just shoot ME. Just shoot me, Eric. Charlie spreads his arms, leaving Knox a plenty wide targ It's a horribly tense moment.       The Angels are frozen Knox decide Charlie's fate. Knox is sweating, debating his choices. Can he really do this? Charlie's not the glamorous, smug asshole he imagin He starts lowering his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You're right. (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just kill you.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: It all happens in the blink of an eye. Knox fires, hittin Charlie in the chest. Natalie leaps out and tackles Knox. Alex dives and grabs the detonator, before it has a chanc to go off. Dylan runs to Charlie's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, no.   NO! She hold shim in her arms as the other Angels gather roun their fallen leader. He gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to say something. Then Dylan notices something weird. He's not gasping for air, there's something stuck in his mouth. With a great, hacking cough, he spits it out. It's a voic chip, like the one Dylan used in the opening scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ucch, that tasted terrible! The voice isn't Charlie's. Dylan reaches down and rips off Charlie's mask, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosley!   Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so. He pulls back the padding from the suit, revealing a smal wound where the bullet grazed his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts, but it looks like it'll heel. Dylan laughs, Alex ruffles his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a second. If Bosley's here... then where's Charlie? The Angels all look at each other.      No one knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In gorgeous SLOW MOTION, the three angels walk side-by-si with a calm assurance, fireballs exploding behind them. They won. As MUSIC rises, the ANGELS TRIPTYCH descends, then peels away to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angels kick back on the white sands, tropical drinks hand. Bosley is there as well, with a grass hat and zinc on his sniffer. Charlie is on the cellular speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great work, angels. You'll be happy to know you received another presidential commendation. The Angels, and Bosley, clink glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your vacation, angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They toast the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, Natalie -- I know you've been putting in some long hours on this case, so I thought you might enjoy a chance to catch up with some old friends.

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND JASON
dialogues.text: walking across the beach towards them. Each is carrying a drink of his own. They wave. Damn those men look good. Alex and Natalie share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance you'll be joining us, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: A SUNNY DECK
dialogues.text: We're in Charlie's point-of-view. We can see part of his reflection in the window -- not enough to see his face, but we get some sense of the man. He turns away, begins walking.    Steps down onto the san

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cell phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, Angels. But I have some precious treasures to watch over. With that, he hangs up. We stay in his P.O.V., walking across the beach. And it's not just any beach.

dialogues.speaker: PETE AND JASON
dialogues.text: approaching.    We're on the same beach. Looking right, we see the backs of the Angels and Bosley. They have no idea that Charlie is walking right behind th A beat, then Dylan looks back. She looks directly as us -- at Charlie -- tracking as we move past. Does she somehow recognize it's Charlie? From her reaction, it's not clear. A beat, then we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan looks back forward again. Did she just see Charlie? Her smile tells us she thinks she did. She raises a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Charlie. They knock glasses. Right at the moment we should probably fade out, Bosley spills his icy drink in his lap. His eyes go wide. The Angels just have to laugh. We FREEZE FRAME, then... CUT TO BLACK.
